mediation.test 1.2.0
  • Reference

Package index

All functions

compute_map_rejection_probs()
Computes the "map" of rejection probabilities for the Bayes risk optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane. The Bayes risk is induced by either the 0-1 or the bounded quadratic loss function.
map_01_0.01
The map of rejection probabilities for the Bayes risk optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane that is induced by the 0-1 loss function for a 0.01 type-I error. No truncation required.
map_01_0.05
The map of rejection probabilities for the Bayes risk optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane that is induced by the 0-1 loss function for a 0.05 type-I error. No truncation required.
map_quad_0.01
The map of rejection probabilities for the Bayes risk optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane that is induced by the quadratic loss function for a 0.01 type-I error. No truncation required.
map_quad_0.01_0.1
The map of rejection probabilities for the Bayes risk optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane that is induced by the quadratic loss function for a 0.01 type-I error, /!\ and a 0.1 truncation /!\.
map_quad_0.05
The map of rejection probabilities for the Bayes risk optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane that is induced by the quadratic loss function for a 0.05 type-I error. No truncation required.
map_quad_0.05_0.1
The map of rejection probabilities for the Bayes risk optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane that is induced by the quadratic loss function for a 0.05 type-I error, /!\ and a 0.1 truncation /!\.
mediation_test_Bayes()
Carries out the Bayes risk optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane.
mediation_test_minimax()
Carries out the minimax optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane.
mediation_test_minimax_BH()
Carries out the minimax optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane, aiming for a control of false discovery rate à la Benjamini-Hochberg.
plot(<map.rejection.probabilities>)
Plots the "map" of rejection probabilities for the Bayes risk optimal test of the composite null "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y=0\)" against its alternative "\(\delta_x \times \delta_y\neq 0\)" based on the test statistic in the real plane.
plot(<mediation.test>)
Plots the output of functions mediation_test_minimax and mediation_test_Bayes with the rejection region.
print(<mediation.test>)
Prints the output of functions mediation_test_minimax and mediation_test_Bayes.

Developed by Antoine Chambaz, Caleb Miles.
